page.title: 15Village Life in Wiltshire.
page.content: My grandad is 78. He has lived in a village all his life. He likes living in the country and wouldn't like to see any changes. After getting up he has breakfast about 9 o'clock. He does some gardening. After dinner he watches television. There used to be two chicken farms nearby, one at Woodstock House and one at Brackenbeds, but they are no longer there. When he was young the{village school} had about 65 pupils. There was one teacher in the little room and three in the big room. In the playground the boys and the girls were separated by a fence. He remembers two coronations and war time evacuees from London.
